body: hi i just heard about map skins and that you could try many skins for free but only you can see them and wounder if i use it could i be banned? I need to know if riot accept this or not (if not i will not use it)

replies.body: We aren't currently banning that for now, but that can change.  Keep in mind, though, that we don't support any third party programs or modifications either.  If there are hidden malicious content in these apps or if you run into any issues, you would be liable for it.  Be wary and use at your own risk!

Are you guys going to give out warnings (instead of permabans) if your stance on certain programs change?

After joining the modding community I realized most League mods are coded by high school kids, so malicious content is actually a huge risk (kids are dumb, and "fuck everyone, here's a virus" is actually a thing they might do in an update to their program). That's also why a lot of the programs get abandoned - they're made by students who move on to bigger, better things.

I was also wondering if you ever plan to solve this in the future by being more open about your packages and proprietary filetypes. The way you **_intentionally_** make it hard to mod League drives away actual experienced professional programmers (like me) because it's not worth their time to learn. This is part of the reason why the modding community is just a bunch of ragtag hobbyist kids testing their skills (and I have to trust their programs instead of making my own).

"But That Evelynn, you could always just not use mods!" - mods are the only way to mute unneeded sounds in the game that I don't like (specifically, the noisy HUD, eg: the "cannot cast that skill right now" noise, which actually hurts my ears and drives me insane).
